ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove, the deer park.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.2_0: At one time the monks winter, transparent a large congenitally blind to a lump of water.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.3_0: Being heated by the fire, a black snake came out of the log and attacked the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.4_0: The monks ran here and there.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.5_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.6_0: “How can those monks light a fire to warm themselves?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that some monks did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.10_0: “... How can those foolish men light a fire to warm themselves?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.12_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.13.1_0: ‘If a monk lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.1.14_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.1_0: At one time a number of monks were sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.2_0: The monks who were looking after them asked,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.3_0: “We hope you’re bearing up, we hope you’re comfortable?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.4_0: “Previously we had entered a fire to warm himself,” and so she crashed them.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.6_0: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t get afraid of wrongdoing. Because of that we’re not comfortable.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.7_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.8_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to light a fire to warm himself, or to have one lit.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.9_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.10.1_0: ‘If a monk who is not sick lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, he commits an offense entailing confession.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:1.2.11_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks did not light lamps, small fires, or saunas because they were afraid of wrongdoing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.2_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.3_0: “Monks, I allow you to light a fire to warm themselves in a fire.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.4_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:2.5.1_0: ‘If a monk who is not sick lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is an suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.6_0: who is comfortable without a fire.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.8_0: who is not comfortable without a fire.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.14_0: if he lights it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.16_0: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.17_0: If he only asks once, then even if the other lights many fires, he commits one offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.18_0: Except if there is a suitable reason:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.1.19_0: unless there is an suitable reason.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.1_0: If he is not sick, and he does not perceive himself as sick, and he lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is an suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.2_0: If he is not sick, but he is unsure of it, and he lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is an suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.3_0: If he is not sick, but he perceives himself as sick, and he lights a fire to warm himself, or has one lit, except if there is an suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.4_0: If he puts back a burning piece of wood that has fallen off, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.5_0: If he is sick, but he perceives himself as not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.6_0: If he is sick, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.2.7_0: If he is sick, and he perceives himself as sick, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.3_0: if he warms himself over a fire lit by another;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.4_0: if he warms himself over flameless coals;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.5_0: if he lights a lamp, a small fire, or a sauna, when there is an suitable reason;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc56:3.3.9_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
